summary:
I strive for social justice and am driven by systemic change to move towards a world where all peoples have equal access to fundamental rights (asylum, self-determination, education, housing...) 

Born at 371,15 ppm.

« We know too well that our freedom is incomplete without the freedom of Palestinians » N. Mandela

Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere

I wholly coordinated, organized and facilitated a round-table within the 'Migrations' Master co-lead by the EHESS & Paris 1 Panthéon-Sorbonne, proudly inviting Rima Hassan (Jurist & OCR's Founder-President) and Benoit Hamon (Ex-Education Minister & SINGA's CEO) to engage with masters' students to discuss about the mechanisms to achieve an intercultural inclusive society, eg grasping domination systems, racism, identity, sharing power to the people of concern, decolonization and French integration & universalism.

My missions within SINGA Global's team consisted in:

- Assisting in communications’ and lobbying strategies

- Assisting advocacy work with parliamentary, private and non-governmental entities to deconstruct & reshape the current security-oriented narratives, both in French & English. 

- Provided general administrative support, including managing emails, and correspondence related to the organization’s activities.

- Scheduling and calendar management: organize and maintain schedules, appointments, meetings, and travel arrangements for executives or team members. This includes coordinating calendars, making reservations, and ensuring all necessary arrangements are in place.

- Meeting and event support: manage planning, organizing, and coordinating meetings, conferences, and events. This includes arranging venues, coordinating logistics, sending invitations, and preparing materials.

- Assist in scheduling and coordinating meetings, workshops, and events.

- Support the planning and execution of events, such as community gatherings, cultural exchanges, and awareness campaigns.

- Assist in creating and formatting documents, reports, and presentations related to program activities and events.

- Conduct research.

- Help maintain organized filing systems for program-related documents.", 'title': 'Executive Project Intern', 'employment_type': 'Civil Service Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Jifundishe Free Library', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Ngongongare, Arusha, Tanzania', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Jifundishe Free Library', 'description': '6 weeks working with the Entrepreneurship Program, Independent Study Program and the Library. 
Jifundishe—«\xa0teach yourself\xa0» in Swahili, a grassroots initiative is one of the only educational institution in the country which is free for all Tanzanians. People of every age and from everywhere in the country come to acquire the skills to successfully pass university exams despite the hardships.', 'title': 'Development Intern', 'employment_type': As a team member I was responsible for organizing meetings, building social network, brainstorming & executing creative ideas in a business model.
